The Science & Story Behind It

The success of ‘Air-Breather Mini’ is built upon its unique physiology and selective breeding for controlled environments.

  • The dwarfism is a result of selecting for early maturation and a truncated growth curve, focusing energy on reaching a small, optimal harvest size quickly rather than continuous growth.
  • The air-breathing capability is a natural trait that has been enhanced through selective breeding for efficiency; fish with larger, more vascularized suprabranchial labyrinths were chosen, allowing them to thrive in systems where other fish would be stressed by temporary oxygen drops.
  • The clean, rich flavor is ensured by selecting against the geosmin-accumulation traits found in some wild populations and maintaining the fish on a controlled, clean diet that prevents off-flavors.

In short, City Catfish ‘Air-Breather Mini’ is a resilient, fast-growing, and flavor-rich cultivar, a perfect urban aquaculture candidate that turns the challenge of high-density rearing into an opportunity for producing a premium, versatile protein.
